case_vignette: A 4-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of a 1-month history of generalized fatigue. During the past week, he has also had fever and severe leg pain that keeps him awake at night. Examination shows cervical and axillary lymphadenopathy. His liver is palpated 4 cm below the right costal margin and the spleen is palpated 3 cm below the left costal margin. His hemoglobin concentration is 10.2 g/dL, leukocyte count is 64,500/mm3, and platelet count is 29,000/mm3. A bone marrow aspirate predominantly shows immature cells that stain positive for CD10, CD19, and TdT.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
